title: $:/litClock/times/-05:30-Timothy Mo
quote_first: Gideon has been most unlike Gideon. As Walter Eastman is preoccupied himself, he has not had time, or more to the point, inclination, to notice aberrant behaviour. For instance, it is
quote_last: in the summer morning. Young Chase’s narrow bachelor bed has evidently been slept in, for it is rumpled in that barely disturbed way which can never be counterfeited. His jug’s empty and there’s grey water in the basin, cleanly boy. The window is open, admitting the salubrious sea-breeze. He doesn’t smoke anyway. What an innocent room it is.

title: $:/litClock/times/-05:30-Charlotte Brontë
quote_last: , and the sun was on the point of rising; but I found the kitchen still dark and silent. … The stillness of early morning slumbered everywhere .. the carriage horses stamped from time to time in their closed stables: all else was still.

title: $:/litClock/times/-05:30-Gabriel García Márquez
quote_first: On the day they were going to kill him, Santiago Nasar got up at
quote_last: in the morning to wait for the boat the bishop was coming on.
